techmeme.title: Chinese regulators propose taking over online identity verification from companies to give people a single internet ID, citing privacy and online fraud (New York Times)
District of Columbia AG Brian Schwalb sues StubHub, alleging the company uses "deceptive, manipulative, and unfair practices" to advertise event fees to users (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Researchers: vulnerabilities in Badoo, Bumble, Grindr, happn, Hinge, and Hily let malicious users pinpoint locations to two meters; the apps fixed the issue (Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai/TechCrunch)

An investigation finds 450+ illicit drug ads on Facebook and Instagram from March to June 2024, some showing bottles or bricks of cocaine; Meta removed the ads (Salvador Rodriguez/Wall Street Journal)
Nothing unveils the Phone 2A Plus, offering the same 6.7-inch display as the 2A and a new MediaTek Dimensity 7350 Pro 5G SoC, available for $399 on August 7 (Andrew Liszewski/The Verge)
